title: Natural Language Processing Capabilities - Context-Aware Understanding of Commands
summary: As a developer, I want the ALFRED system to have natural language processing capabilities that understand context-aware commands so that I can create applications that allow elderly users to interact seamlessly with the system while ensuring that caregivers can easily access relevant information.

title: Voice Command Customization – User-Defined Command Phrases
summary: As a developer, I want to enable users to customize voice command phrases so that elderly users can better interact with the system in a way that feels natural and familiar to them.

title: User-Controlled Notification Settings
summary: As a developer, I want to implement user-controlled notification settings so that elderly users can customize alerts related to their health and social activities, ensuring they receive only the most relevant information while maintaining a user-friendly experience.

title: Multi-Device Interaction Support – Seamless Transition Between Devices
summary: As a developer, I want to ensure that applications I create for ALFRED can seamlessly transition between devices, allowing users to access their health monitoring and social features regardless of the device they are using, so that elderly users and their caregivers can maintain continuity in their interactions and care.

title: Contextual Assistance and Recommendations
summary: As a developer, I want the ALFRED system to provide contextual assistance and recommendations based on user behavior patterns so that I can create applications that enhance user engagement and effectively address the needs of elderly users and their caregivers.

title: Guided Recovery Steps for Misunderstood Commands
summary: As a developer, I want to implement guided recovery steps for when the ALFRED system misunderstands user commands, so that elderly users can easily recover from errors and continue using the application without frustration.

title: Interaction Personalization Settings – User-Defined Preferences for Interaction Style
summary: As a developer, I want to enable users to customize their interaction styles with ALFRED, so that elderly users can have a more tailored and comfortable experience while using the system.

title: Accessibility Features for Voice Interaction – Speech Recognition for Users with Speech Impairments
summary: As a developer, I want to implement speech recognition features that accommodate users with speech impairments, so that I can create applications that are accessible and user-friendly for elderly users and caregivers.
